sn7.6:1.2: Then the brahmin Jaṭā Bhāradvāja, Bhāradvāja of the Tangle, approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.6:1.3: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side
sn7.6:1.4: and addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn7.6:2.2: This generation is entangled in a tangle.
sn7.6:2.3: I ask you this, O Gotama,
sn7.6:3.1: [The Blessed One: ]  “A man established on virtue, wise,
sn7.6:4.2: Along with ignorance have been expunged,
sn7.6:4.4: For them the tangle is disentangled.
sn7.6:5.3: And also impingement and perception of form:
sn7.6:5.4: It is here this tangle is cut. ”
sn7.6:6.1: When this was said, the brahmin Jaṭā Bhāradvāja said to the Blessed One:
sn7.6:6.3: And the Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the arahants.
